title: Facebook millionaire Palmer Luckey sells drones to UK military
text:
British military chiefs have bought a fleet of drones that can detect unmanned aircraft from 27-year-old Facebook millionaire Palmer Luckey.

The shipments were revealed as Anduril Industries, which Mr Luckey founded in 2018 after he was fired from Oculus Rift, the virtual reality company he sold to Mark Zuckerberg for $2.2bn (£1.8bn), as the company unveiled a new fleet of drone killing Interceptor drones on Thursday.

Using Anduril’s Lattice system, soldiers can verify targets and launch the drones to smash into helicopter-style rotary or fixed-wing drones in any environment, day or night. It can decipher unmanned aerial vehicle targets from humans or animals.
